Irvington Science Alliance centers activism around a singular intent – to instill science, technology, engineering, and mathematics interest in students from a very young age and help students gain an edge in an increasingly competitive academic environment. Today, ISA continues to act upon these motivations by partnering with local elementary schools, in which high school “mentors” guide 5th and 6th grade “buddies” through their Science Fair project. In addition, Science Alliance organizes the annual Dine With a Scientist event to provide local students an opportunity to speak to Bay Area professors, engineers, and graduate students of diverse expertise and background; it has helped connect over 500 students with researchers in the past three years.

I analyzed the photocatalytic abilities of heterophasic metal chalcogenide-graphene composites in Dr. Velázquez Group as part of COSMOS at UC Davis. I also studied the effects on absorptivity of altering pi-bridges in the bulk heterojunction blend of dye-sensitized solar cells (DSSCs).
